snippet: The American Petroleum Institute files a petition in federal court challenging new Transportation rules intended to make moving oil by rail safer.
abstract: American Petroleum Institute petitions federal appeals court in Washington, DC, to block key provisions of rules intended to improve safety of oil-by-train transportation; suit contends that provisions will impose high costs on industry and lead to shortfall in tank car capacity.
lead_paragraph: The American Petroleum Institute files a petition in federal court challenging new Transportation rules intended to make moving oil by rail safer.

headline.main: Oil Industry Asks Court to Block Rail Transport Safety Rules
headline.print_headline: Oil Industry Files Challenge to New Rail Safety Rules
